instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-4924 no backlight
threads.message: Hi guys, this one has got me going crazy..... So i have an 820-4924 with no backlight, usually my favourite repairs. Sometimes it works for a day and then its off again. Board looks superclean. Changed the display cable as these are not good in many cases, same issue. Changed the display for a know working one, same issue. 38-49v on the connector, so it has voltage. So I assumed it was inside the connector, which i eplaced, still the same issue. Is there any othe voltage/dataline i need to get backlight besides PPVOUT?

threads.title: 820-4924 no backlight
threads.message:
39V is the correct voltage.
49V means open line to LED strips on the screen.

Do you always get image, only missing backlight?
Check I2C_BKLT_SCL/SDA and EDP_BKLT_PWM lines.
You should get o-scope activity when pressing backlight adjust keys.

threads.title: 820-4924 no backlight
threads.message: 39v is with the original display installed. 49v i got with my testing display, that is actually cracked.  Yes its always missing backlight, not a black display. When i turn it on display shows. I close the lid, open it again and the backlight is off. With a flashlight I can see the login screen. When i press the backlight adjustment keys the screen actually seems to blink. Will check these 2 lines now, what diode mode reading should these have?

threads.title: 820-4924 no backlight
threads.message:
I have 3.3v on BKLT_EN_R
on pin 3 & 4 5v on both with no display
On pin 3 -> 5v and pin 4 -> 3.1v with original display connected
Does that say something?

o-scope I have to do monday not at hand.

threads.title: 820-4924 no backlight
threads.message:
Wait, do you get normal image (with backlight) at first start?
Original Apple Magsafe 2 85W charger tried?
Do NOT use 1-->2 adapter for this machine!
Also try disconnecting internal SSD; use USB OSX.

threads.title: 820-4924 no backlight
threads.message: Your test screen is the wrong screen so only use the broken one. At 39 volts it should work..measure SMC_LID when it doesn?t work
